content: Enter 6-digit generated code from your app. If you don't have access to your phone, use the backup codes.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display instructions for users to enter a 6-digit code generated from their app. The description explains that if users cannot access their phone, they can use backup codes instead, appearing in a UI element within the TFA Auth page.

usage.context:
<>
{t("EnterAppCodeTitle")} {t("EnterAppCodeDescription")}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation uses a full stop (.) at the end of each sentence, which is more common in formal Arabic. While not strictly incorrect, using a less formal punctuation (or no punctuation) might be more natural in a user interface.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing or modifying the full stops for a more conversational tone. Alternatively, ensure consistent punctuation use throughout the application.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Ã–z tÉ™tbiqinizdÉ™n É™ldÉ™ etdiyiniz" can be improved. A more natural phrasing would be "TelefonunuzdakÄ± tÉ™tbiqinizdÉ™n". While technically correct, the current translation sounds slightly awkward.

The phrase 'anmelden' (login) is a less direct translation of 'use the backup codes.' A more appropriate translation might be 'kÃ¶nnen Sie Ihre Back-up-Codes verwenden' or 'kÃ¶nnen Sie Ihre Ersatzcodes nutzen'. 'Anmelden' implies a complete login process, while the English phrase simply indicates using the codes as an alternative.

The phrase "desde su aplicaciÃ³n" is a literal translation and sounds unnatural in Spanish. It would be more natural to say "de tu aplicaciÃ³n" (informal) or "de su aplicaciÃ³n" (formal, but potentially too formal depending on the app's tone).  The current phrasing makes it sound like the code is originating *from* the application, rather than being accessed *through* it.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, 'cÃ³digos de reserva' is a direct translation of 'backup codes'. A more common and natural phrasing in Spanish would be 'cÃ³digos de seguridad' or 'cÃ³digos alternativos'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "generated code" is not accurately translated. While "àº—àºµà»ˆàºªà»‰àº²àº‡àº‚àº¶à»‰àº™" conveys a sense of creation, a more accurate translation of 'generated' in this context would be something closer to 'àº—àºµà»ˆàº–àº·àºàºªà»‰àº²àº‡àº‚àº·à»‰àº™à»‚àº”àºàº­àº±àº”àº•àº°à»‚àº™àº¡àº±àº”' or 'àº—àºµà»ˆàº–àº·àºàºªà»‰àº²àº‡àº‚àº·à»‰àº™'.
While not a strict error, consider adding a period after 'à»€àºˆàº»à»‰àº²' for better readability.

The phrase 'generated code from your app' is translated as 'cÃ³digo de 6 dÃ­gitos gerado atravÃ©s da sua app'. While technically correct, a more natural and common phrasing in Portuguese would be 'cÃ³digo de 6 dÃ­gitos gerado no seu aplicativo' or 'cÃ³digo de 6 dÃ­gitos gerado pelo seu aplicativo'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'gererat' is a misspelling of 'generat'. It should be 'generat' to correctly translate 'generated'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'generated' is not accurately translated. 'à¶‹à¶­à·Šà¶´à·à¶¯à·’à¶­' (uthpaaditha) implies 'produced' or 'manufactured' which doesn't quite capture the meaning of 'generated' in this context. A more accurate translation might convey the sense of 'created' or 'issued'.
The number 6 is included as a Sinhala character ð‘‡¦ (riya). This is unconventional and will likely cause display issues. It should be a standard numeral.
